info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:12AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN SHELBY, NORTHWESTERN CHAMPAIGN, SOUTHERN DARKE, NORTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY AND MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 AM EDT... At 1011 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Greenville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Troy, Piqua, Vandalia, Greenville, Tipp City, New Carlisle, West Milton, Covington, Arcanum, Bradford, Pleasant Hill, New Madison, Brown, Clayton, Union, Webster, Wayne Lakes, Christiansburg and Gettysburg. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 64 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
